message.content:
cs.GT, cs.MA, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.EC. 

The paper discusses auction mechanisms and their effectiveness in irregular markets where bidders' values are drawn from non-iid distributions. This topic falls under the field of game theory and mechanism design, which is covered by the cs.GT sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of targeted advertising campaigns to recruit bidders from different population groups, which involves machine learning and data analysis techniques covered by the cs.AI sub-category. The use of Vickrey auctions and single-reserve approximations involves algorithmic and computational aspects covered by the cs.DS sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the revenue implications of different auction mechanisms, which falls under the field of economics and is covered by the cs.EC sub-category.
